title: Help on a Scala Alternative
content:
Hi All,  
I'm after some advice on a job we're doing at the moment -  
Our client is opening a venue with a modern-deco feel and we are trying to find a suitable typeface as their corporate font.  
We love Scala Sans - however for several reasons we are unable to use that exact face - can anyone suggest an alternate face? I particularly love the crossed 'W' and anything that gives a sophisticated feel would be great.

Many Thanks,  
Paul.

author: pbags

comments.content:
Can you be more specific about your reasons?

Martin Majoor released a follow up to FF Scala last year called [FF Nexus](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=24&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=nexus&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE).

Other sans serifs with crossing 'W's:

[FF Seria Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=20&displayfontid=FF.11179.0.0&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE)  
 [Adderville](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=20&displayfontid=FF.11179.0.0&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE)  
 [Claude Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=5&displayfontid=ITC.100314.0.0&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE)  
 [Kabel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=M.125989.0.0&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE)  
 [ITC Stone Humanist](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=6&displayfontid=M.126077.0.0&fontRendererText=WHITE+WINE)

These are more deco than contemporary, but they stand the test of time:

[Bernhard Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=243081&grab_id=0&page_id=38595&query=bernhard&SCOPE=Fonts) (especially nice set all-caps)

[Stellar](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=401221&grab_id=0&page_id=35614&query=stellar&SCOPE=Fonts) (great caps, excellent for architectural graphics)

Hi,  
Thanks for the replies - much appreciated.

We've already looked at Neutra - but the low x height isn't quite as subtle as we'd like.

Stephen - reasoning for not using Scala is that our client came to us with a sample menu from another venue which uses Scala as their corporate face - (although they no longer exist we don't simply want to imitate what had been done prior - especially that they are in the same field)

[http://www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm "http://www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm")

Nice cap W on Bliss  
Tim

[Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Nobel)

[Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html)

both slightly Deco but no crossed W's.

I think Nexus and Seria Sans will probably be too similar to Scala (in fact I don't really get why he released Nexus at all) if you're trying to distinguish yourself from the earlier design.

You could also have a look at [Parisine/Parisine Plus](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/ParisinePlusPTF), very lovely.

[Jigsaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.typotheque.com/site/fonts.php?id=7) is beautiful as well.

Patty - I was a little perplexed by the FF Nexus release as well, but it slowly became clear. The family was developed together from the ground up, resulting in a much more compatible set of fonts. I am still a huge FF Scala fan, but FF Nexus serves well if congruous slab, sans, serif, and mono variants are all needed.

More here: [http://www.fontshop.com/virtual/newsletters/ff35/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008160042/http:/www.fontshop.com/virtual/newsletters/ff35/ "http://www.fontshop.com/virtual/newsletters/ff35/")
